intro: Calonemorchis dilatata, commonly known as the broadleaf burrhead, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features a basal rosette of broad, heart-shaped leaves with a hairy surface. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Calonemorchis dilatata is often found in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges.
